N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 517.5 - Transfer of emergency patient

State Regulations
(a) A
patient on emergency admission status may be admitted to another hospital
pursuant to the provisions of article 9 of the Mental Hygiene Law governing
involuntary admission on application supported by medical certification, without the necessity of obtaining an order of transfer. (b) When transfer of a patient is effected
pursuant to subdivision (a) of this section: (1)
the sending hospital shall give to the

Mental Hygiene Legal Service prior written notice of such transfer; and
(2)
the receiving hospital
shall give notice in accordance with section
517.4
(i) of this

Part. (c) When, pursuant
to subdivision (a) of this section, a patient who is under 21 years of age and
is a recipient of medical assistance is transferred to a State-operated
psychiatric center, a certification of need form shall be completed by the
sending hospital and submitted to the receiving hospital upon transfer. The
certification of need form shall be completed as described in section
517.4
(b)(3)
of
this Part. If it is determined that the transfer of a patient is necessary in
order to prevent serious impairment or deterioration of the health of the
patient, or to prevent immediate serious physical harm to the patient or
others, the sending hospital is not required to complete a certification of
need form. In such cases, the receiving hospital shall complete the
certification of need form within 14 days after the patient's admission to the
receiving hospital. Notes
